info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 01 at 9:58PM CST until March 01 at 10:45PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CST FOR NORTHERN MARION COUNTY... At 958 PM CST, a confirmed tornado was located 7 miles north of Weston, or 9 miles northwest of Hamilton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Haleyville, Hackleburg, Bear Creek, Pigeye, Tessner and Upper Bear Creek Reservoir. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
